support.p: A round, monolithic sandstone column. Beside Samudragupta's praśasti, it also bears two inscriptions by Aśoka as well as a number of mediaeval inscriptions, some of which are written between and over the lines of Samudragupta's inscription.

layout.p: The last line of the inscription is 180 cm above the point where the column starts from its present pedestal.

handDesc.p: northern class, called eastern Gupta by Bhandarkar

history.p: The pillar was found, and still remains, in Allahabad fort. It was possibly moved here from Kauśāmbī by Firoz Śāh or another early Delhi Sultan.
